instruction: My favorite witty review of The Rings of Power series is this:
output:
"What a disappointment! I was expecting The Lord of the Rings, but instead got The Lords of the Rings. It's like they took all the best parts out and replaced them with boring political intrigue and pointless subplots."

I feel this way because I am a fan of Tolkien's works, and after watching the first two episodes of the series, I was hoping for an adaption that would be true to the spirit of the books. Instead, we get a very watered down version of what makes Tolkien's world so great, with characters that are barely recognizable from their source material, and a plot that feels like it's just going through the motions.

But perhaps this is the point. Maybe the showrunners realize that people like me are looking for a faithful adaption, and so they're trying to subvert our expectations by creating something that is not only different from the books, but also (in my opinion) inferior to them.

If this is the case, then I have to ask: Why? Why create a new work that is so obviously inferior to its source material? Why not just make a completely new fantasy series, one that is unencumbered by the expectations of fans like me?

Maybe the answer lies in the fact that there is no such thing as a fresh idea anymore. Everything has been done before, and we know it. So when a new work comes along that tries to rehash something that's already been done, we can't help but compare it to the original. And if it falls short, we're bound to be disappointed.
So maybe the real question here is: How do we move beyond this cycle of derivative works, where everything is just a rehash of something else? How do we create truly new and innovative stories that capture our imagin

instruction: What are the steps to using random (yet coherent) text as filler content within your Word document?
output:
Sure, there are many reasons why you might want to add random filler text to a Word document. For example, when you're writing a newspaper article and you don't quite have enough content yet, or maybe you're just experimenting with design options and need some filler text to see how the page will look with different fonts and sizes. Whatever your reason for wanting to add random text to your Word document, it's easy to do so using a built-in feature that Word has to offer.
1. Open up a new Word document.: You can do this by clicking on "New" in the "Files" tab of the upper left corner of Word. From there, select "Microsoft Word Template," and then click on "Blank Document."
2. Type your main body text.: Add your introduction, body, and conclusion as you normally would. After you've typed all of your content, type a period at the end of your last sentence, and then hit "Enter" once more to start a new line.
3. Go to "Insert.": This is located in the "File" tab in the upper left corner of Word.
4. Select "Text Box.": This option is in the "Insert" menu, under "Shapes."
5. Click on "OK": You should now see a box with rounded corners that says "Place Text Here."
6. Type your random text.: Make sure that the font is one that you want to use on your final document, and make sure that it fits well within the text box.
If you'd like to change the font size or style, right click inside the text box and select "Format Font" from the context menu that appears. You can also use the "Font" option in the "Home" tab to change the font after you've started typing.
7. Click outside of the text box.: Once you'

Here's how it works: Start with a compelling opening line that captures attention, then use sensory details to bring the reader into your experience, describe your key achievements and donâ€™t be afraid to use numbers and metrics to prove your success, and conclude with a strong call to action that invites the reader to connect with you.

instruction: Make a list of desirable Skills for software engineers to add to LinkedIn.
output:
A software engineer is a person who applies the principles of software engineering to the design, development, maintenance, testing, and evaluation of computer software. They are responsible for the development and maintenance of software systems, writing code, and debugging programs. Software engineers also have knowledge of algorithms and data structures, and they can apply these to solve complex problems.
To be an effective software engineer, you should possess strong problem-solving skills, good communication skills, and the ability to work well in a team environment. You should also have a strong understanding of computer science concepts, such as object-oriented programming and algorithm design. Additionally, knowledge of scripting languages, such as Python or Java, is important for building software applications.

instruction: Write an email to attendees as a reminder that the event is coming up.
output: If you are organizing an event, it is important to send reminder emails. Reminder emails serve as a friendly reminder to attendees that the event is coming up and they should make their plans to attend. The email should include important information such as the date, time, and location of the event, as well as any last-minute details or updates. It is also a good idea to include a polite request for RSVP so that organizers have an idea of how many people to expect. A well-timed reminder email can be just what participants need to make sure they donâ€™t forget about your event

instruction: You are given some reviews for a movie. Each video might have mentioned some negative or positive points about the movie. Read them carefully and extract the positive and negative points mentioned in all of the reviews. Then, make a list of these points and summarize them as positive points and negative points.
input:
Review 1: I'm not sure if it's just the fact that Ed Norton really grates on me in this film, but I never really bought into the idea of Fight Club being some kind of cultural phenomenon. Yes it's an innovative story, told via a strong script, engaging characters and intense cinematography. But is it really worthy of such high praise? Personally, I find it starts to fall apart halfway through and actually becomes quite tedious towards the end. Everything just becomes a little bit childish and contrived as the story loses touch with its base elements and the rage against the machine vibe takes over. I have huge respect for the way this film was made but, much like The Matrix, I feel like people attach way more importance to this movie than it deserves.
Review 2: The film tells the story of men who cannot adapt to the social order in today's world, under the leadership of Tyler Durden, to discover their natural instinct, masculinity, and to escape from their unhappy lives.
Review 3: Despite a good theme, great acting and important messages that this movie convey in an unorthodox way, I think it fails to connect the audience with the storyline and leaves him in a world of confusion. Although, majority of reviews find this movie entertaining and interesting, yet I would choose to be a minority that believes that this movie is extremely overrated.
Review 4: Is creating chaos, explosions and membership in a militant sect the way to get rid of material shackles ?! The visual effects are fascinating and the story is compelling until the second half. Unfortunately, it doesn't end well.

instruction: Write a short analysis of the cinematography in the movie.
input: Dead Poets Society
output: is a 1989 American drama film directed by Peter Weir, from a screenplay written by Tom Schulman. The film concerns a English teacher who inspires his students to seize the day and reach for their dreams. The film's title refers to the literary and philosophical movement of the same name. It was the directorial follow-up to Weir's successful thriller Witness (1985), and was an critical success.

instruction: Summarize the article you have been given in a brief manner.
input:
Mathematics and art are related in a variety of ways. Mathematics has itself been described as an art motivated by beauty. Mathematics can be discerned in arts such as music, dance, painting, architecture, sculpture, and textiles. This article focuses, however, on mathematics in the visual arts.
Mathematics and art have a long historical relationship. Artists have used mathematics since the 4th century BC when the Greek sculptor Polykleitos wrote his Canon, prescribing proportions conjectured to have been based on the ratio 1:âˆš2 for the ideal male nude. Persistent popular claims have been made for the use of the golden ratio in ancient art and architecture, without reliable evidence. In the Italian Renaissance, Luca Pacioli wrote the influential treatise De divina proportione (1509), illustrated with woodcuts by Leonardo da Vinci, on the use of the golden ratio in art. Another Italian painter, Piero della Francesca, developed Euclid's ideas on perspective in treatises such as De Prospectiva Pingendi, and in his paintings. The engraver Albrecht DÃ¼rer made many references to mathematics in his work Melencolia I. In modern times, the graphic artist M. C. Escher made intensive use of tessellation and hyperbolic geometry, with the help of the mathematician H. S. M. Coxeter, while the De Stijl movement led by Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian explicitly embraced geometrical forms. Mathematics has inspired textile arts such as quilting, knitting, cross-stitch, crochet, embroidery, weaving, Turkish and other carpet-making, as well as kilim. In Islamic art, symmetries are evident in forms as varied as Persian girih and Moroccan zellige tilework, Mughal jali pierced stone screens, and widespread muqarnas vaulting.
output:
Mathematics has been used for art in the 20th and 21st centuries, notably by the Russian constructivists and the Polish school of mathematical graphics.
Mathematics also plays a role in the interpretation of visual art, through such topics as fractal analysis, the study of self-similarity in art, and mathematical aesthetics.

instruction: Estimate the cost of supplies required to create the given project and calculate the total cost.
input:
DIY Water Chiller
Required items are: Ice-maker, Icebox/cooler, Temperature regulator, Aquarium pump x2, 12V power supply
output:
, Water pump, Tube fittings, Tank for chilled water, Cooling fans.
Instructions: Connect the water pump to the ice-maker and coolant reservoir. Connect the temperature regulator between the water pump and ice-maker. Run the cold water from the ice-maker into the aquarium pump which in turn will run into a tank filled with water at a lower temperature. This water will be pumped back into the ice-maker as coolant. Connect the second aquarium pump to return the water to its original temperature. Finally, connect the temperature regulator between the second pump and the ice-maker to maintain a constant temperature.

instruction: Describe the content of the article in a brief manner.
input: A study published earlier this year by Zee and her team examined the role of light in sleep for healthy adults in their 20s. Sleeping for only one night with a dim light, such as a TV set with the sound off, raised the blood sugar and heart rate of the young people during the sleep lab experiment. An elevated heart rate at night has been shown in prior studies to be a risk factor for future heart disease and early death, while higher blood sugar levels are a sign of insulin resistance, which can ultimately lead to type 2 diabetes.
output:
The researchers also found that when the young adults spent a second night in the lab with the lights dimmed, their bodies adjusted somewhat to the lower light level. The changes in blood sugar and heart rate were reduced compared with the first night. But both remained higher than they were when the participants slept in a well-lit room.
â€œWe know that sleep is so important for health,â€ Zee said. â€œThis study shows that one aspect of sleep â€” the light environment â€” is not benign.â€
Ani Manjikiani, an assistant professor of neurology at Brigham and Womenâ€™s Hospital and Harvard Medical School who was not involved in the study, called it â€œvery interesting.â€
â€œThere are other studies that have looked at sleep and glucose metabolism, but this is the first time Iâ€™ve seen them looking at sleep and heart rate variability,â€ Manjikiani said.
Heart rate variability refers to the variations in the time between each heartbeat. A personâ€™s overall heart rate variability is influenced by factors such as age, physical fitness and emotional state. Higher overall heart rate variability has been associated with better outcomes, including survival after a heart attack and improved cardiovascular health after reperfusion of the heart following a heart attack. Lower heart rate variability has been linked to increased risk of death and heart disease.
â€œIt makes sense physiologically that if you have less variability, your body is not very good at recovering from stressors,â€ Manjikiani said.
Zee said she thinks the results could extend to all types of light â€” not just the light produced by TV sets and computer screens. And the findings likely apply equally to children and older adults, she said.
â€œLight at night can disrupt circadian rhythms, which are important across the life

instruction: Classify the tweet into one of the following three categories: event, demo, or news. Event is a happening, often social or public, that people attend or are aware of. Demo is a  public showing or presentation of something, typically to promote or advertise it. And, news is information about recent events or happenings, especially as reported by news media.
input: Using this tutorial, you can analyze and classify a userâ€™s review as either positive or negative using sentiment analysis features in an existing Next.js app. We show you how to leverage language AI into your applications. Check it out â†“
output: Opinions expressed by Entrepreneur contributors are their own. When the pandemic began, small businesses were hit hard as customers stayed home and shoppers shifted to digital channels. E-commerce sales increased by 30 percent in April 2020 compared to the same period a year earlier, according to data from Adobe Analytics. Unfortunately, many small businesses didnâ€™t have the resources to scale quickly to meet the demand for online shopping. In fact, an October 2020 report found that 96 percent of small businesses lacked an e-commerce website at the beginning of the pandemic. With more consumers making purchases online this holiday season than ever before, itâ€™s critical that small businesses have a strong online presence â€” including an e-commerce store. If you donâ€™t have one yet, itâ€™s not too late to get started. Keep reading to learn how you can easily set up an e-commerce site with Shopify .

instruction: As part of software engineering, user stories describe what the user wants the system to do, while acceptance criteria describe the conditions a specific user story must meet. Create basic acceptance criteria based on the given user story.
input: User story: As a user, I want to use a search field to type a city, name, or street, so that I could find matching hotel options.
output: Acceptance criteria: The user must be able to type a city, name, or street in the search field and press enter to trigger a search for matching hotel options.

instruction: Include important study notes and key points that someone should know about the given subject.
input: history of the USA
output:
, 1980 to present
- Ronald Reagan was the 40th president of the United States. His policies were conservative and he focused on reducing government spending. He also strengthened relations with Western Europe and Japan as part of his strategy for defeating communism.
- George H.W. Bush became the 41st president in 1989. He continued Reagan's foreign policy but faced difficulties at home due to the recession and increasing public dissatisfaction with the government.
- Bill Clinton was elected president in 1992. He focused on health care reform, reducing the deficit, and strengthening the middle class. He also signed a bill allowing gays to serve openly in the military.
- George W. Bush was elected president in 2000. He believed in limited government and free markets. He supported the War on Terror and the Patriot Act.
- Barack Obama was elected president in 2008. He focused on health care reform, the economy, and civil rights. He also signed the Affordable Care Act into law.

instruction: Predict how many stars the author will give to the restaurant from a Yelp review.
input:
The reviews were great, but honestly i felt it was just ok. Seemed like a typical tourist spot were the food was mediocre. The service was ok, not great, but not the worst.
The bread was very good. I ordered the muscle fries. They had a sweet Vidalia onion flavor. No need for fries bc they were soggy wo much flavor. My boyfriend ordered a pesto chicken pasta and it was again mediocre.
output:
No pesto flavor at all. It was a good portion size and the pasta was al dente but thatâ€™s it.
We both got drinks from the specialty cocktail menu. My boyfriend got the tiki drink which was fantastic. I got the tequila sunrise and it was just ok.

instruction: Provide instructions for the given exercise.
input: Leg Raises
output: : Start in a push-up position with your hands planted on the floor in line with your shoulders and your feet together. Engage your core and raise one leg off the ground, keeping your toes pointed. Hold for a second, then lower yourself back down. That's one rep. Do as many reps as you can in 60 seconds.

instruction: Write what the pronunciation of the given word sounds like. Follow the "Google pronunciation dictionary" scheme for phonetic spelling.
input: interpretations
output:
1. act of interpreting; explanation or exposition of a text, idea, or phenomenon; translation: The movie is an interpretation of the book by the same name. 2. mental process of understanding a concept, feeling, or emotional state and being able to express it in one's own words: What is the interpretation of this behavior?
Is there any correct way to pronounce "interpretation"?
